# Software Requirements Specification
## Traffic Monitoring System

*Auto-generated by Compliance Coder V-Model Engine*
*Generated: 2026-01-12T10:19:47.821Z*

---

## Document Overview

This document specifies the software requirements for Traffic Monitoring System.
Requirements are derived from analyzed code functionality and follow ASPICE SWE.1 standards.

**Traceability:** REQ → ARCH → DESIGN → CODE (each level traces to adjacent levels)

## Requirements


### REQ-001: Real-Time Vehicle Detection Accuracy

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall detect and classify vehicles in video frames with an accuracy of at least 95%.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The detection accuracy shall be measured using a standard dataset and must achieve a minimum precision and recall of 95%.
- The system shall provide a report of detection accuracy metrics after processing a minimum of 1000 video frames.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-001

---


### REQ-002: Real-Time Processing Latency

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall process video frames and provide vehicle detection results within 200 milliseconds.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The average processing time for each video frame shall not exceed 200 milliseconds under normal operating conditions.
- The system shall log the processing time for each frame, and 95% of the logged times shall be less than or equal to 200 milliseconds.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-002

---


### REQ-003: Vehicle Detection Result Output

**Priority:** critical
**Feature:** F1

**Description:**
The system shall output vehicle detection results in a structured format that includes bounding boxes, class labels, and confidence scores.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The output format shall include bounding box coordinates (x, y, width, height), class label (e.g., car, truck), and confidence score (0-1).
- The system shall return detection results for each processed frame within the specified latency, ensuring that the output is consistent and correctly formatted.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-003
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-003

---


### REQ-004: ROI Visualization

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall visualize Regions of Interest (ROIs) for detected vehicles on the user interface.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall display ROIs as distinct overlays on the video feed with a minimum resolution of 1080p.
- The system shall update the ROI visualization in real-time with a maximum latency of 200 milliseconds.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-004

---


### REQ-005: ROI Management

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall allow users to create, modify, and delete ROIs for detected vehicles.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall enable users to create a new ROI by selecting a region on the video feed, which shall be confirmed by a visual indication.
- The system shall allow users to modify an existing ROI by dragging its borders, and the changes shall be reflected immediately on the interface.
- The system shall allow users to delete an ROI, and the deletion shall be confirmed by a prompt before removal.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-005

---


### REQ-006: ROI Data Export

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F2

**Description:**
The system shall provide functionality to export ROI data for further analysis.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall allow users to export ROI data in CSV format, including the coordinates and timestamps of the ROIs.
- The export functionality shall be accessible within 3 clicks from the main interface.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-002
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-006

---


### REQ-007: Notification Triggering

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall send real-time notifications to users when a traffic event is detected.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall send a notification within 5 seconds of detecting a traffic event.
- The notification shall include the type of traffic event and the location of the event.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-005
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-007

---


### REQ-008: User Notification Preferences

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall allow users to configure their notification preferences for traffic events.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall provide options for users to enable or disable notifications for specific types of traffic events.
- The system shall save user preferences and apply them to all future notifications.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-005
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-008

---


### REQ-009: Notification Delivery Method

**Priority:** high
**Feature:** F3

**Description:**
The system shall deliver notifications to users via their preferred communication channel.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall support at least two delivery methods: push notifications and email.
- The system shall deliver notifications using the user's selected method within 5 seconds of the event detection.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-005
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-009

---


### REQ-010: Video Feed Format Support

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall support video input in standard formats including H.264, MPEG-4, and MJPEG.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall successfully process video feeds in H.264 format without loss of data.
- The system shall successfully process video feeds in MPEG-4 format without loss of data.
- The system shall successfully process video feeds in MJPEG format without loss of data.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-001
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-010

---


### REQ-011: Video Input Latency

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall ensure that video input processing latency does not exceed 200 milliseconds.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall measure and log the latency for each video input feed.
- The system shall trigger an alert if the latency exceeds 200 milliseconds for any video input.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-011
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-011

---


### REQ-012: Error Handling for Video Input

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F4

**Description:**
The system shall detect and log errors in video input processing.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall log an error message when a video feed fails to initialize.
- The system shall log an error message when a video feed is interrupted or lost.
- The system shall provide a recovery mechanism to attempt re-establishing the video feed within 5 seconds of detection.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-012
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-012

---


### REQ-013: Environment Setup Utility

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall provide a utility function that allows developers to configure the system environment with predefined settings.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The utility shall accept a configuration file as input and apply the settings within 5 seconds.
- The utility shall log the configuration process and report any errors encountered during setup.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-013
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-013

---


### REQ-014: Model Download Functionality

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall provide a function to download necessary models from a specified repository.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The download function shall successfully retrieve models and store them in the designated local directory within 10 seconds.
- The function shall verify the integrity of the downloaded models by checking their checksums against the repository.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-014
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-014

---


### REQ-015: User Feedback Mechanism

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F5

**Description:**
The system shall provide feedback to the user during the setup and configuration process.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall display progress messages during the setup and model download processes.
- The system shall provide a summary report upon completion, indicating success or failure of each step.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-015
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-015

---


### REQ-016: Log Traffic Event Data

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F6

**Description:**
The system shall log traffic classes and timestamps for detected events.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall log at least 95% of detected traffic events within 1 second of detection.
- Each log entry shall include the traffic class, timestamp, and a unique event identifier.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-016
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-016

---


### REQ-017: Access Traffic Event Logs

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F6

**Description:**
The system shall provide an interface for traffic analysts to access logged traffic events.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall allow traffic analysts to retrieve logs for a specified date range.
- The system shall return logs in a structured format (e.g., JSON or CSV) within 2 seconds of a request.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-017
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-017

---


### REQ-018: Log Storage and Retention

**Priority:** medium
**Feature:** F6

**Description:**
The system shall store traffic event logs for a minimum of 30 days.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- The system shall ensure that logs are not deleted or overwritten for at least 30 days after creation.
- The system shall provide a mechanism to archive logs older than 30 days without data loss.

**Traceability (SWE.1):**
- Architecture Components: ARCH-018
- Verified by (System Tests): SYS-TEST-018

---
